Comment: Hi! I present one of my first game on GK, a game that i enjoyed and i hope you do so. I made two sacrifice in order to accomplish my idea that i had early in the game. This game show how a pawn is powerful together with a queen and how this alliance can fight against a queen, a rook and a knight. I think it a was a quick and a beautiful game. Enjoy it!
Caro-Kann defense, classical variation

Defencing the d pawn.
I considered this move a big mistake for black. I don't actually see any reason for it. Additionally it weaken the position of e pawn, and this will play a role in the end of the game.
And here I've got the idea and i really don't want to leave the b8-h2 diagonal.

Let's go! The first sacrifice. It half-open the e file for my queen. But this is apparently a sacrifice, because very soon i regain the material.
If 12. ...Qxf6 13.Be5 and black lose a rook.
And voila! I opened another diagonal - b2-h7. The e pawn remain pinned and my bishop intact.
This is my second sacrifice, and the black will take it gladly because they don't see the danger.

Threatening 18. ...Nf3+ but there is poor continuation, and the danger on black king is not eliminated. In my opinion, Blacks here lose the last chance to resist. Because the White's forces are targeting the h8 square, moving the queen away from the 8th row would offer to Blacks more defensive possibilities.
